intro: Haloragis tetragonia, commonly known as the four-angled dock, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant features alternate, narrow, and often hairy leaves that are distinctly four-angled in cross-section. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Haloragis tetragonia is adapted to saline and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
